biography: Joseph Goldstein is one of the first American vipassana teachers, co-founder of the Insight Meditation Society (IMS) with Jack Kornfield and Sharon Salzberg, a contemporary author of numerous popular books on Buddhism, a resident guiding teacher at IMS, and a leader of retreats worldwide on insight (vipassana) and lovingkindness (metta) meditation. An early promoter of insight practice and awareness, Goldstein is credited as an influence in the rise of mindfulness practices in the US since he started hosting workshops in 1974.

*   **Management of Coronary Artery Disease:** Developing treatment plans for patients with coronary artery disease, including lifestyle modifications, medications, and referral for percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) or coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) when appropriate.

*   **Management of Valvular Heart Disease:** Diagnosing and managing valvular heart disease, including aortic stenosis, aortic regurgitation, mitral stenosis, and mitral regurgitation. This would involve medical therapy and referral for valve repair or replacement when appropriate.
